identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study of the Efficacy and Safety of Bronchoscopic Airway Clearance and Amphotericin B Spraying in Patients With ABPA
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Prospective, Multicenter, Observational Cohort Study on the Efficacy and Safety of Bronchoscopic Airway Clearance and Amphotericin B Spraying in Patients With Allergic Bronchopulmonary Aspergillosis

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of bronchoscopic airway clearance and amphotericin B spraying in the treatment of allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis

bioSpec.description: Serum, plasma, sputum, bronchoalveolar lavage fluid, urine, stool

armGroups.label: Observation group
armGroups.description: The observation group was treated with standard drug therapy (oral glucocorticoids combined or not combined with oral antifungal drugs), combined with bronchoscopic airway clearance and amphotericin B spraying treatment
interventionNames: Procedure: The patients were treated with bronchoscopic airway clearance and amphotericin B spraying

armGroups.label: Control group
armGroups.description: Control group: The control group was treated with standard drug therapy (oral glucocorticoids with or without oral antifungal drugs). The previous treatment for bronchial asthma was maintained, including inhaled corticosteroids + long-acting β-receptor agonists, leukotriene receptor antagonists, etc.

interventions.name: The patients were treated with bronchoscopic airway clearance and amphotericin B spraying
interventions.description: In addition to standard medical therapy (oral glucocorticoids with or without oral antifungal agents), bronchoscopic airway clearance and bronchoscopic spraying of amphotericin B (depending on the effectiveness of bronchoscopic mucus plug removal, At least one time of bronchoscopic airway clearance and amphotericin B spraying). The previous treatment for bronchial asthma was maintained, including inhaled corticosteroids + long-acting β-receptor agonists, leukotriene receptor antagonists, etc.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Radiographic response rate after 4 months of treatment
primaryOutcomes.description: Radiographic remission: defined as the removal of mucus plugs in the airway on radiographic examination

primaryOutcomes.measure: Immunological remission rate after 4 months of treatment
primaryOutcomes.description: Immunological remission: defined as at least a 50% decrease in total serum IgE from baseline

primaryOutcomes.measure: The remission rate of clinical symptoms after 4 months of treatment
primaryOutcomes.description: Clinical symptom relief: The semi-quantitative rating of clinical symptoms was evaluated using Likert scores with at least 50% improvement in symptoms

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of acute exacerbations within 1 year of drug withdrawal after 4 months of treatment
Number of acute exacerbations within 2 years after 4 months of treatment
Number of hospitalizations due to acute exacerbations of allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis
Time from discontinuation to first exacerbation
After drug withdrawal, the number of patients who achieved treatment remission
secondaryOutcomes.description: The remission phase was defined as sustained (\>6 months) clinical-radiologic improvement in the absence of (or discontinuation of) glucocorticoid therapy and the absence of an increase in total serum IgE of 50% or more from the last recorded value during the stable phase

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Quality of life score (AQLQ or mini-AQLQ)
psychological Scale (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, HADS)

eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients diagnosed with allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis included patients with newly diagnosed allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis and patients with acute exacerbation of allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis after drug withdrawal.

locations.facility: Department of Respiratory, The First Affiliated Hospital of Shandong First Medical University & Shandong Provincial Qianfoshan Hospital, #16766, Jingshi Road, Jinan City, Shandong Province, China
